New Records: Hunter Goodman hit two home runs, including a tiebreaking grand slam in the eighth inning, and the Colorado Rockies came back to beat the Chicago Cubs 9-5.
Hunter Goodman finished with three hits and a career-high seven RBI, the first seven-RBI game by a Rockies player since Elías Díaz also had seven on Sept. 9, 2022 against Arizona.
Key Match Events: Hunter Goodman hit a tiebreaking grand slam in the eighth inning
Ezequiel Tovar hit his 23rd home run of the season
Brendan Rodgers added a run-scoring double for the Rockies
Pre-Game Insights: There were no pre-game insights mentioned in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: Hunter Goodman said: "But everybody rallied together. We had a great offensive night, not just from me. We had a lot of big hits from some of the other guys right there in order for me to hit the grand slam. It was just a great night overall."
Rockies manager Bud Black said: "They’re wanting to make a statement, letting us know that they’re major league players, and a night like this from Goodie helps his cause."
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockies snapped a six-game losing streak to the Cubs
With the loss, Chicago fell six games behind the Mets for the third NL wild card
Austin Gomber, reinstated from a three-day stay on the paternity list, went six innings and allowed two runs on nine hits
Others: Kris Bryant's recovery from a back strain has slowed to the point his return this season is unlikely, manager Bud Black said.
